group_1.textLeft: Whew...
You think so?@I wasn't so sure, myself.

group_1.textRight: Ah, yes.@Before you went into battle...
...there was something you intended to ask me,@correct?

group_1.textLeft: ...Oh yeah, that.
If I hadn't made a contract with you...
I wonder if Grams wouldn't have found that pot of gold...
The Tomorrow Shop would've been signed over...
And an apartment building would've gone up in its place?
Or: Even if I hadn't made the wish...
Would Grams have noticed the seal around the@board peeling up...
...and found the pot of gold anyway?

group_1.textRight: I really can't say.@Either outcome would have been possible.

group_1.textLeft: Well, if I had just told Grams about the pot of gold...
I wonder if I could've saved the Tomorrow Shop in exactly the same way as it ended up.

group_1.textRight: She also found the documents proving it was her spouse's bequest.
...that both of these would be found together.

group_1.textLeft: Right, right...@But, even without your help...
I was SO close to this miracle.

group_1.textRight: But remember that things don't always go as@planned.

group_1.textLeft: For example... Even if the money was ready to go, maybe the land shark would've been a bigger@problem?
Like, if he hadn't backed off or whatever.

group_1.textRight: In that respect, it was very sensible that you wished@for the shop's survival.
In so doing, you averted an outcome in which the money was available, but the shop still closed...@for example.

group_1.textLeft: I see.
So really, if I hadn't wished for a miracle, there@would have been, like, an 80% chance...
But that was changed into a 100% chance...is what you're saying, right?

group_1.textRight: I can't say whether those numbers are accurate or@not, but yes, you've understood correctly.
...Could it be that you regret making your contract?

group_1.textLeft: ...Hm.@No-- I don't know.
I came so close to this outcome on my own, but@ended up leaning on the wish I made...
...so it's really hard to say whether this was a good@deal or not.
I really believed it was dirty money.
So, I wasn't going to tell Grams about it.
I really don't know...
...whether she would have found the pot of gold@on her own or not.
Well, anyway, I'm glad the Tomorrow Shop isn't@closing!
As per the contract, I got a miracle.@And I'll keep up my end of the bargain.
So with that, our accounts are clear...@We're good, right?

group_1.textCenter: I'm not totally satisfied with that explanation, but... Well, it turned out alright in the end!
